example.name: 2D Painting Example
example.description: The 2D Painting example shows how QPainter and QGLWidget can be used together to display accelerated 2D graphics on supported hardware.

example.name: Address Book Example
example.description: The address book example shows how to use proxy models to display different views onto data from a single model.

example.name: Analog Clock Example
example.description: The Analog Clock example shows how to draw the contents of a custom widget.

example.name: Animated Tiles Example
example.description: The Animated Tiles example animates items in a graphics scene.

example.name: Animation: Basics Example
example.description: This example shows how to create and combine animations in QML.

example.name: Animation: Basics Property Animation Example
example.description: This example shows how to create and combine animations in QML.

example.name: Animation: Behavior Example
example.description: This example shows how to use QML behaviors.

example.name: Animation: Easing Example
example.description: This example shows the different easing modes available for animations.

example.name: Animation: States Example
example.description: These examples show how to use states and transitions.

example.name: Application Chooser Example
example.description: The Application Chooser example shows how to use the Qt state machine and the animation framework to select between applications.

example.name: Application Example
example.description: The Application example shows how to implement a standard GUI application with menus, toolbars, and a status bar. The example itself is a simple text editor program built around QPlainTextEdit.

example.name: Application Icon Example
example.description: The Application Icon example shows how to add an application icon to a mobile application.

example.name: Arrow Pad Example
example.description: ThArrow Pad Linguist example is a slightly more involved and introduces a key Qt Linguist concept: "contexts". It also shows how to use two or more languages.

example.name: Audio Devices Example
example.description: The Audio Devices example demonstrates the basic use of QAudioDeviceInfo class provided with Qt.

example.name: Audio Output Example
example.description: The Audio Output example demonstrates the basic use of the QAudioOutput class provided with Qt.

example.name: AudioInput Example
example.description: The Audio Input example demonstrates the basic use of QAudioInput class provided with Qt.

example.name: Basic Drawing Example
example.description: The Basic Drawing example shows how to display basic graphics primitives in a variety of styles using the QPainter class.

example.name: Basic Graphics Layouts Example
example.description: The Basic Graphics Layouts example shows how to use the layout classes in QGraphicsView: QGraphicsLinearLayout and QGraphicsGridLayout. In addition to that it shows how to write your own custom layout item.

example.name: Basic Layouts Example
example.description: The Basic Layouts example shows how to use the standard layout managers that are available in Qt: QBoxLayout, QGridLayout and QFormLayout.

example.name: Basic Sort/Filter Model Example
example.description: The Basic Sort/Filter Model example illustrates how to use QSortFilterProxyModel to perform basic sorting and filtering.

example.name: Bearer Cloud Example
example.description: The Bearer Cloud example shows how to use the Bearer Management API to monitor the connectivity state of the local device.

example.name: Bearer Monitor Example
example.description: The Bearer Monitor example shows how to use the Bearer Management API.

example.name: Blocking Fortune Client Example
example.description: The Blocking Fortune Client example shows how to create a client for a network service using QTcpSocket's synchronous API in a non-GUI thread.

example.name: Blur Picker Effect Example
example.description: The Blur Picker Example shows the QGraphicsBlurEffect in action.

example.name: Border Layout Example
example.description: The Border Layout example shows how to create a custom layout that arranges child widgets according to a simple set of rules.

example.name: Broadcast Receiver Example
example.description: The Broadcast Receiver example shows how to receive information that is broadcasted over a local network.

example.name: Broadcast Sender Example
example.description: The Broadcast Sender example shows how to broadcast information to multiple clients on a local network.

example.name: C++ Extensions: Image Provider Example
example.description: This examples shows how to use QDeclarativeImageProvider to serve images to QML image elements.

example.name: C++ Extensions: Plugins Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a C++ plugin extension by subclassing QDeclarativeExtensionPlugin.

example.name: C++ Extensions: QWidgets Example
example.description: This example shows how to embed QWidget-based objects into QML using QGraphicsProxyWidget.

example.name: Cached Table Example
example.description: The Cached Table example shows how a table view can be used to access a database, caching any changes to the data until the user explicitly submits them using a push button.

example.name: Calculator Builder Example
example.description: The Calculator Builder example shows how to create a user interface from a Qt Designer form at run-time, using the QUiLoader class.

example.name: Calculator Example
example.description: The example shows how to use signals and slots to implement the functionality of a calculator widget, and how to use QGridLayout to place child widgets in a grid.

example.name: Calculator Form Example
example.description: The Calculator Form Example shows how to use a form created with Qt Designer in an application by using the user interface information from a QWidget subclass.

example.name: Calendar Example
example.description: The Calendar example shows how to create rich text content and display it using a rich text editor.

example.name: Calendar Widget Example
example.description: The Calendar Widget example shows use of .

example.name: Capabilities Example
example.description: The Backend Capabilities example shows how to check which MIME types, audio devices, and audio effects are available.

example.name: Carnet d'Adresses 4 - éditer et supprimer des adresses
example.description: No description available

example.name: Carnet d'Adresses 6 - Sauvegarde et chargement
example.description: No description available

example.name: Carnet d'adresse 5 - Ajout d'une fonction de recherche
example.description: No description available

example.name: Carnet d'adresse 7 - Fonctionnalités avancées
example.description: No description available

example.name: Carnet d'adresses 1 - Conception de l'interface utilisateur
example.description: No description available

example.name: Carnet d'adresses 2 - Ajouter des adresses
example.description: No description available

example.name: Carnet d'adresses 3 - Navigation entre les éléments
example.description: No description available

example.name: Chapter 1: Creating a New Type
example.description: No description available

example.name: Chapter 2: Connecting to C++ Methods and Signals
example.description: No description available

example.name: Chapter 3: Adding Property Bindings
example.description: No description available

example.name: Chapter 5: Using List Property Types
example.description: No description available

example.name: Character Map Example
example.description: The Character Map example shows how to create a custom widget that can both display its own content and respond to user input.

example.name: Chart Example
example.description: The Chart example shows how to create a custom view for the model/view framework.

example.name: Class Wizard Example
example.description: The License Wizard example shows how to implement linear wizards using QWizard.

example.name: Code Editor Example
example.description: The Code Editor example shows how to create a simple editor that has line numbers and that highlights the current line.

example.name: Codecs Example
example.description: The Codecs example demonstrates the principles behind importing and exporting text using codecs to ensure that characters are encoded properly, avoiding loss of data and retaining the correct symbols used in various scripts.

example.name: Colliding Mice Example
example.description: The Colliding Mice example shows how to use the Graphics View framework to implement animated items and detect collision between items.

example.name: Color Editor Factory Example
example.description: The Color Editor Factory example shows how to create an editor that can be used by a QItemDelegate.

example.name: Combo Widget Mapper Example
example.description: The Combo Widget Mapper example shows how to use a custom delegate to map information from a model to specific widgets on a form.

example.name: Completer Example
example.description: The Completer example shows how to provide string-completion facilities for an input widget based on data provided by a model.

example.name: Concentric Circles Example
example.description: The Concentric Circles example shows the improved rendering quality that can be obtained using floating point precision and anti-aliasing when drawing custom widgets. The example also shows how to do simple animations.

example.name: Config Dialog Example
example.description: The Config Dialog examples shows how a configuration dialog can be created by using an icon view with a stacked widget.

example.name: Container Extension Example
example.description: The Container Extension example shows how to create a custom multi-page plugin for Qt Designer using the QDesignerContainerExtension class.

example.name: Context2D Example
example.description: This Qt Script example is an implementation of the Context2D API.

example.name: Cube OpenGL ES 2.0 example
example.description: The Cube OpenGL ES 2.0 example shows how to write mouse rotateable textured 3D cube using OpenGL ES 2.0 with Qt.

example.name: Custom Completer Example
example.description: The Custom Completer example shows how to provide string-completion facilities for an input widget based on data provided by a model. The completer pops up suggestions for possible words based on the first three characters input by the user and the user's choice of word is inserted into the using QTextCursor.

example.name: Custom Sort/Filter Model Example
example.description: The Custom Sort/Filter Model example illustrates how to subclass QSortFilterProxyModel to perform advanced sorting and filtering.

example.name: Custom Type Sending Example
example.description: The Custom Type Sending example shows how to use a custom type with signals and slots.

example.name: Custom Widget Plugin Example
example.description: The Custom Widget example shows how to create a custom widget plugin for Qt Designer.

example.name: D-Bus Chat Example
example.description: The D-Bus Chat example shows how to use D-Bus to communicate between two applications.

example.name: D-Bus Remote Controlled Car Example
example.description: The Remote Controlled Car example shows how to use D-Bus to control one application using another.

example.name: DOM Bookmarks Example
example.description: The DOM Bookmarks example provides a reader for XML Bookmark Exchange Language (XBEL) files that uses Qt's DOM-based XML API to read and parse the files.

example.name: DOM Traversal Example
example.description: The DOM Traversal example shows how to use the QWebElement class to access the structure of a Web page.

example.name: Default Prototypes Example
example.description: The Default Prototypes QtScript example shows how to use default prototypes to make a non-QObject-based type scriptable.

example.name: Delayed Encoding Example
example.description: The Delayed Encoding example shows how to delay preparing of data for drag and drop operations until a drop target is found.

example.name: Diagram Scene Example
example.description: The Diagram Scene example is an application in which you can create a flowchart diagram using the graphics view framework.

example.name: Digital Clock Example
example.description: The Digital Clock example shows how to use QLCDNumber to display a number with LCD-like digits.

example.name: Dir View Example
example.description: The Dir View example shows a tree view onto the local filing system. It uses the QDirModel class to provide file and directory information.

example.name: Dock Widgets Example
example.description: The Dock Widgets example shows how to add dock windows to an application. It also shows how to use Qt's rich text engine.

example.name: Drag and Drop Puzzle Example
example.description: The Drag and Drop Puzzle example demonstrates a way of using the drag and drop system with item view widgets.

example.name: Drag and Drop Robot Example
example.description: The Drag and Drop Robot example shows how to implement Drag and Drop in a QGraphicsItem subclass, as well as how to animate items using Qt's Animation Framework.

example.name: Draggable Icons Example
example.description: The Draggable Icons example shows how to drag and drop image data between widgets in the same application, and between different applications.

example.name: Draggable Text Example
example.description: The Draggable Text example shows how to drag and drop textual data between widgets in the same application, and between different applications.

example.name: Drill Down Example
example.description: The Drill Down example shows how to read data from a database as well as submit changes, using the QSqlRelationalTableModel and QDataWidgetMapper classes.

example.name: Drop Site Example
example.description: The Drop Site example shows how to distinguish the various MIME formats available in a drag and drop operation.

example.name: Easing Curves Example
example.description: The Easing Curves example shows how to use easing curves to control the speed of an animation.

example.name: Echo Plugin Example
example.description: The Echo Plugin example shows how to create a Qt plugin.

example.name: Editable Tree Model Example
example.description: The Editable Tree Model example shows how to implement a simple item-based tree model that can be used with other classes in the model/view framework.

example.name: Elastic Nodes Example
example.description: The Elastic Nodes example shows how to implement edges between nodes in a graph, with basic interaction.

example.name: Elided Label Example
example.description: The Elided Label example creates a widget similar to QLabel, that elides the last visible line, if the text is too long to fit the widget's geometry.

example.name: Extension Example
example.description: The Extension example shows how to add an extension to a QDialog using the QAbstractButton::toggled() signal and the QWidget::setVisible() slot.

example.name: FTP Example
example.description: The FTP example demonstrates a simple FTP client that can be used to list the available files on an FTP server and download them.

example.name: Factorial States Example
example.description: The Factorial States example shows how to use The State Machine Framework to calculate the factorial of an integer.

example.name: Fade Message Effect Example
example.description: The Fade Message Example shows the QGraphicsColorizeEffect in action.

example.name: Fancy Browser Example
example.description: The Fancy Browser example shows how to use jQuery with QtWebKit to create a web browser with special effects and content manipulation.

example.name: Fetch More Example
example.description: The Fetch More example shows how two add items to an item view model on demand.

example.name: File System Example
example.description: The File Tree example shows how to use QtXmlPatterns for querying non-XML data that is modeled to look like XML.

example.name: Find Files Example
example.description: The Find Files example shows how to use QProgressDialog to provide feedback on the progress of a slow operation.

example.name: Finger Paint Example
example.description: The Finger Paint example shows the use of a touchscreen with a custom widget to create a simple painting application.

example.name: Flow Layout Example
example.description: The Flow Layout example demonstrates a custom layout that arranges child widgets from left to right and top to bottom in a top-level widget.

example.name: FolderListModel - a C++ model plugin
example.description: The FolderListModel plugin example shows how to make a C++ model available to QML.

example.name: Font Sampler Example
example.description: The Font Sampler example shows how to preview and print multi-page documents.

example.name: Form Extractor Example
example.description: The Form Extractor example shows how to use QWebFrame with JavaScript to extract form data.

example.name: Fortune Client Example
example.description: The Fortune Client example shows how to create a client for a simple network service using QTcpSocket.

example.name: Fortune Server Example
example.description: The Fortune Server example shows how to create a server for a simple network service.

example.name: Framebuffer Object 2 Example
example.description: The Framebuffer Object 2 example demonstrates how to use the QGLFramebufferObject class to render into an off-screen buffer and use the contents as a texture in a QGLWidget.

example.name: Framebuffer Object Example
example.description: The Framebuffer Object example demonstrates how to use the QGLFramebufferObject class to render into an off-screen buffer and use the contents as a texture in a QGLWidget.

example.name: Fridge Magnets Example
example.description: The Fridge Magnets example shows how to supply more than one type of MIME-encoded data with a drag and drop operation.

example.name: Frozen Column Example
example.description: The Frozen Column example demonstrates how to freeze a column within a QTableView.

example.name: Google Chat Example
example.description: The Google Chat example shows how to use implement a simple Google Chat client with QtWebKit.

example.name: Google Suggest Example
example.description: The Google Suggest example demonstrates how to use the QNetworkAccessManager class to obtain a list of suggestions from the Google search engine as the user types into a QLineEdit.

example.name: Grabber Example
example.description: The Grabber examples shows how to retrieve the contents of an OpenGL framebuffer.

example.name: Group Box Example
example.description: The Group Box example shows how to use the different kinds of group boxes in Qt.

example.name: HTTP Example
example.description: The HTTP example demonstrates a simple HTTP client that shows how to fetch files specified by URLs from remote hosts.

example.name: Hello GL ES Example
example.description: The Hello GL ES example is the Hello GL Example ported to OpenGL ES. It also included some effects from the OpenGL Overpainting Example.

example.name: Hello GL Example
example.description: The Hello GL example demonstrates the basic use of the OpenGL-related classes provided with Qt.

example.name: Hello tr() Example
example.description: The Hello tr() example is a small Hello World program with a Latin translation.

example.name: I18N Example
example.description: The Internationalization (I18N) example demonstrates Qt's support for translated text.

example.name: Icons Example
example.description: The Icons example shows how QIcon can generate pixmaps reflecting an icon's state, mode and size.

example.name: Image Composition Example
example.description: The Image Composition example lets the user combine images together using any composition mode supported by QPainter, described in detail in Composition Modes.

example.name: Image Elements: Border Image Example
example.description: These examples show how to use the BorderImage element.

example.name: Image Elements: Image Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the Image element and its fillModes.

example.name: Image Elements: Shadows Image Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the BorderImage element.

example.name: Image Viewer Example
example.description: The Image Viewer example shows how to combine QLabel and QScrollArea to display an image.

example.name: Input Panel Example
example.description: The Input Panel example shows how to create an input panel that can be used to input text into widgets using only the pointer and no keyboard.

example.name: Internationalization Example
example.description: This example shows how to enable text translation in QML.

example.name: Item Views Puzzle Example
example.description: The Puzzle example shows how to enable drag and drop with a custom model to allow items to be transferred between a view and another widget.

example.name: Key Interaction: Focus Example
example.description: This example shows how to handle keyboard input and focus in QML.

example.name: Labs: Shader Effects
example.description: This example shows how to create visual effects by using OpenGL shading language together with QML using ShaderEffectItem and ShaderEffectSource APIs.

example.name: LayoutItem Example
example.description: This example show how to use the LayoutItem element to integrate QML items into an existing Graphics View-based application.

example.name: License Wizard Example
example.description: The License Wizard example shows how to implement complex wizards in Qt.

example.name: Lighting Effect Example
example.description: The Lighting Effect Example shows the QGraphicsDropShadowEffect in action.

example.name: Line Edits Example
example.description: The Line Edits example demonstrates the many ways that QLineEdit can be used, and shows the effects of various properties and validators on the input and output supplied by the user.

example.name: Local Fortune Client Example
example.description: The Local Fortune Client example shows how to create a client for a simple local service using QLocalSocket.

example.name: Local Fortune Server Example
example.description: The Local Fortune Server example shows how to create a server for a simple local service.

example.name: Loopback Example
example.description: The Loopback example shows how to communicate between simple clients and servers on a local host.

example.name: MDI Example
example.description: The MDI example shows how to implement a Multiple Document Interface using Qt's QMdiArea class.

example.name: Maemo Vibration Example
example.description: The Maemo Vibration example shows how to tell the Maemo Mode Control Entity (MCE) to vibrate a maemo device.

example.name: Mandelbrot Example
example.description: The Mandelbrot example shows how to use a worker thread to perform heavy computations without blocking the main thread's event loop.

example.name: Master Detail Example
example.description: The Master Detail Example shows how to present data from different data sources in the same application.

example.name: Menus Example
example.description: The Menus example demonstrates how menus can be used in a main window application.

example.name: Models and Views: AbstractItemModel Example
example.description: This example shows how to use a QAbstractItemModel subclass as a model in QML.

example.name: Models and Views: Alert WebView Example
example.description: This example shows how to create an alert in the WebView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Autosize WebView Example
example.description: This example show how to use autosizing in the WebView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Dynamic List ListView Example
example.description: This example shows how items can be dynamically added to and removed from a ListModel, and how these list modifications can be animated.

example.name: Models and Views: Expanding Delegate ListView Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a dynamic delegate, which expands when selected.

example.name: Models and Views: GoogleMaps WebView Example
example.description: This example shows how to use a web service API and the WebView element.

example.name: Models and Views: GridView Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the GridView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Highlight ListView Example
example.description: This example shows how to highlight one item inside a ListView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Highlight Ranges ListView Example
example.description: This example shows how to highlight ranges within a ListView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Inline HTML WebView Example
example.description: This example shows how to use inline HTML with the WebView element.

example.name: Models and Views: New Windows WebView Example
example.description: These examples show how to create new windows in the WebView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Object ListModel Example
example.description: This example shows how to use a QList<QObject*> as a model in QML.

example.name: Models and Views: Package Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the Package element.

example.name: Models and Views: Parallax Example
example.description: This example shows how to combine and switch between views.

example.name: Models and Views: PathView Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the PathView element.

example.name: Models and Views: Sections ListView Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the ListView element.

example.name: Models and Views: String ListModel Example
example.description: This example shows how to use a QStringList as a model in QML.

example.name: Models and Views: VisualItemModel Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the VisualItemModel element.

example.name: Move Blocks Example
example.description: The Move Blocks example shows how to animate items in a QGraphicsScene using a QStateMachine with a custom transition.

example.name: Movie Example
example.description: The Movie example demonstrates how to use QMovie and QLabel to display animations.

example.name: Multicast Receiver Example
example.description: The Multicast Receiever example shows how to receive information that is sent to a multicast group.

example.name: Multicast Sender Example
example.description: The Multicast Sender example shows how to send information to multiple clients in a multicast group.

example.name: Multiple Inheritance Example
example.description: The Multiple Inheritance Example shows how to use a form created with Qt Designer in an application by subclassing both QWidget and the user interface class, which is .

example.name: Music Player Example
example.description: The Music Player Example shows how to use Phonon - the multimedia framework that comes with Qt - to create a simple music player.

example.name: Network Chat Example
example.description: The Network Chat example demonstrates a stateful peer-to-peer Chat client that uses broadcasting with QUdpSocket and QNetworkInterface to discover its peers.

example.name: Order Form Example
example.description: The Order Form example shows how to generate rich text documents by combining a simple template with data input by the user in a dialog.

example.name: Orientation Example
example.description: The Orientation example shows a simple way to use different UIs depending on the screen orientation of a mobile device.

example.name: Overpainting Example
example.description: The Overpainting example shows how QPainter can be used to overpaint a scene rendered using OpenGL in a QGLWidget.

example.name: Pad Navigator Example
example.description: The Pad Navigator Example shows how you can use Graphics View together with embedded widgets and Qt's State Machine Framework to create a simple but useful, dynamic, animated user interface.

example.name: Painter Paths Example
example.description: The Painter Paths example shows how painter paths can be used to build complex shapes for rendering.

example.name: Part 1 - Designing the User Interface
example.description: No description available

example.name: Part 2 - Adding Addresses
example.description: No description available

example.name: Part 3 - Navigating between Entries
example.description: No description available

example.name: Part 4 - Editing and Removing Addresses
example.description: No description available

example.name: Part 5 - Adding a Find Function
example.description: No description available

example.name: Part 6 - Loading and Saving
example.description: No description available

example.name: Part 7 - Additional Features
example.description: No description available

example.name: Pinch Zoom Example
example.description: The Pinch Zoom example shows how to use low-level touch information to recognize a gesture.

example.name: Ping Pong States Example
example.description: The Ping Pong States example shows how to use parallel states together with custom events and transitions in The State Machine Framework.

example.name: Pixel Buffers 2 Example
example.description: The Pixel Buffers 2 example demonstrates how to use the QGLPixelBuffer class to render into an off-screen buffer and use the contents as a dynamic texture in a QGLWidget.

example.name: Pixel Buffers Example
example.description: The Pixel Buffers example demonstrates how to use the QGLPixelBuffer class to render into an off-screen buffer and use the contents as a dynamic texture in a QGLWidget.

example.name: Pixelator Example
example.description: The Pixelator example shows how delegates can be used to customize the way that items are rendered in standard item views.

example.name: Plug & Paint Example
example.description: The Plug & Paint example demonstrates how to write Qt applications that can be extended through plugins.

example.name: Ported Asteroids Example
example.description: The Ported Asteroids example is a port of the Asteroids game, which was based on QCanvas, to the Graphics View framework.

example.name: Ported Canvas Example
example.description: The Ported Canvas example is a port of the old QCanvas example from Qt 3 to the Graphics View framework.

example.name: Positioners Example
example.description: This example shows how to use positioner elements such as Row, Column, Grid and Flow.

example.name: Previewer Example
example.description: The Previewer example shows how to use QtWebKit's QWebView to preview HTML data written in a QPlainTextEdit.

example.name: QGraphicsGridLayout Example
example.description: This example shows how to use QGraphicsGridLayout to lay out QML items. This is useful if you need to integrate Qt Graphics View layouts with QML.

example.name: QGraphicsLinearLayout Example
example.description: This example shows how to use QGraphicsLinearLayout to lay out QML items. This is useful if you need to integrate Qt Graphics View layouts with QML.

example.name: QML Advanced Tutorial 1 - Creating the Game Canvas and Blocks
example.description: No description available

example.name: QML Advanced Tutorial 2 - Populating the Game Canvas
example.description: No description available

example.name: QML Advanced Tutorial 3 - Implementing the Game Logic
example.description: No description available

example.name: QML Advanced Tutorial 4 - Finishing Touches
example.description: No description available

example.name: QObject XML Model Example
example.description: The XML Model example shows how to use QtXmlPatterns to query QObject trees by modeling the non-XML data structure of a QObject tree to look like XML.

example.name: QXmlStream Bookmarks Example
example.description: The QXmlStream Bookmarks example provides a reader for XML Bookmark Exchange Language (XBEL) files using Qt's QXmlStreamReader class for reading, and QXmlStreamWriter class for writing the files.

example.name: Qt Script Tetrix Example
example.description: The QSTetrix example is a Qt Script version of the classic Tetrix game.

example.name: QtConcurrent Progress Dialog Example
example.description: The QtConcurrent Progress Dialog example shows how to use the QFutureWatcher class to monitor the progress of a long-running operation.

example.name: QtScript Calculator Example
example.description: In the QtScript Calculator example, we show how to implement the functionality of a calculator widget.

example.name: Query Model Example
example.description: The Query Model example shows how to make customized versions of data obtained from a SQL query, using a model that encapsulates the query and table views to display the results.

example.name: Queued Custom Type Example
example.description: The Queued Custom Type example shows how to send custom types between threads with queued signals and slots.

example.name: RSS-Listing Example
example.description: The RSS-Listing example shows how to create a widget that displays news items from RDF news sources.

example.name: Recent Files Example
example.description: The Recent Files example shows how a standard File menu can be extended to show the most recent files loaded by a main window application.

example.name: Recipes Example
example.description: The Recipes example shows how to use QtXmlPatterns to query XML data loaded from a file.

example.name: Regular Expressions Example
example.description: The Regular Expressions (RegExp) example shows how regular expressions in Qt are applied to text by providing an environment in which new regular expressions can be created and tested on custom text strings.

example.name: Relational Table Model Example
example.description: The Relational Table Model example shows how to use table views with a relational model to visualize the relations between items in a database.

example.name: Right-to-left User Interfaces: Layout Direction Example
example.description: No description available

example.name: Right-to-left User Interfaces: Layout Mirroring Example
example.description: This example shows how to mirror the application layouts using LayoutMirroring attached property.

example.name: Rogue Example
example.description: The Rogue example shows how to use the Qt state machine for event handling.

example.name: SAX Bookmarks Example
example.description: The SAX Bookmarks example provides a reader for XML Bookmark Exchange Language (XBEL) files that uses Qt's SAX-based API to read and parse the files.

example.name: SDI Example
example.description: The SDI example shows how to create a Single Document Interface. It uses a number of top-level windows to display the contents of different text files.

example.name: SIP Dialog Example
example.description: The SIP Dialog example shows how to create a dialog that is aware of the Windows Mobile SIP (Software Input Panel) and reacts to it.

example.name: SQL Widget Mapper Example
example.description: The SQL Widget Mapper example shows how to use a map information from a database to widgets on a form.

example.name: SVG Generator Example
example.description: The SVG Generator example shows how to add SVG file export to applications.

example.name: SVG Viewer Example
example.description: The SVG Viewer example shows how to add SVG viewing support to applications.

example.name: Sample Buffers Example
example.description: The Sample Buffers example demonstrates how to use and enable sample buffers in a QGLWidget.

example.name: Screenshot Example
example.description: The Screenshot example shows how to take a screenshot of the desktop using QApplication and QDesktopWidget. It also shows how to use QTimer to provide a single-shot timer, and how to reimplement the QWidget::resizeEvent() event handler to make sure that an application resizes smoothly and without data loss.

example.name: Scribble Example
example.description: The Scribble example shows how to reimplement some of QWidget's event handlers to receive the events generated for the application's widgets.

example.name: Secure Socket Client Example
example.description: The Secure Socket Client example shows how to use QSslSocket to communicate over an encrypted (SSL) connection. It also demonstrates how to deal with authenticity problems, and how to display security and certificate information.

example.name: Settings Editor Example
example.description: The Settings Editor example shows how Qt's standard settings support is used in an application by providing an editor that enables the user to view the settings for installed applications, and modify those that can be edited.

example.name: Shaped Clock Example
example.description: The Shaped Clock example shows how to apply a widget mask to a top-level widget to produce a shaped window.

example.name: Shared Memory Example
example.description: The Shared Memory example shows how to use the QSharedMemory class to implement inter-process communication using shared memory.

example.name: Simple DOM Model Example
example.description: The Simple DOM Model example shows how an existing class can be adapted for use with the model/view framework.

example.name: Simple Decoration Example
example.description: The Simple Decoration example shows how to create a custom window decoration for embedded applications.

example.name: Simple Selector Example
example.description: The Simple Selector example shows how to use QWebElement to access the Document Object Model (DOM) in a Web page.

example.name: Simple Text Viewer Example
example.description: The Simple Text Viewer example shows how to use Qt Assistant as a customized help viewer for your application.

example.name: Simple Tree Model Example
example.description: The Simple Tree Model example shows how to create a basic, read-only hierarchical model to use with Qt's standard view classes.

example.name: Simple Widget Mapper Example
example.description: The Simple Widget Mapper example shows how to use a widget mapper to display data from a model in a collection of widgets.

example.name: Sliders Example
example.description: Qt provides three types of slider-like widgets: QSlider, QScrollBar and QDial. They all inherit most of their functionality from QAbstractSlider, and can in theory replace each other in an application since the differences only concern their look and feel. This example shows what they look like, how they work and how their behavior and appearance can be manipulated through their properties.

example.name: Spin Box Delegate Example
example.description: The Spin Box Delegate example shows how to create an editor for a custom delegate in the model/view framework by reusing a standard Qt editor widget.

example.name: Spin Boxes Example
example.description: The Spin Boxes example shows how to use the many different types of spin boxes available in Qt, from a simple QSpinBox widget to more complex editors like the QDateTimeEdit widget.

example.name: Standard Dialogs Example
example.description: The Standard Dialogs example shows the standard dialogs that are provided by Qt.

example.name: Star Delegate Example
example.description: The Star Delegate example shows how to create a delegate that can paint itself and that supports editing.

example.name: States Example
example.description: The States example shows how to use the Qt state machine to play animations.

example.name: Stickman Example
example.description: The Stickman example shows how to animate transitions in a state machine to implement key frame animations.

example.name: Style Plugin Example
example.description: The Style Plugin example shows how to create a plugin that extends Qt with a new GUI look and feel.

example.name: Style Sheet Example
example.description: The Style Sheet Example shows how to use style sheets with Qt.

example.name: Styles Example
example.description: The Styles example illustrates how to create custom widget drawing styles using Qt, and demonstrates Qt's predefined styles.

example.name: Symbian Vibration Example
example.description: The Symbian Vibrator example shows how to get fine-grained vibration control on Symbian devices.

example.name: Syntax Highlighter Example
example.description: The Syntax Highlighter example shows how to perform simple syntax highlighting by subclassing the QSyntaxHighlighter class.

example.name: System Tray Icon Example
example.description: The System Tray Icon example shows how to add an icon with a menu and popup messages to a desktop environment's system tray.

example.name: Tab Dialog Example
example.description: The Tab Dialog example shows how to construct a tab dialog using the QTabWidget class.

example.name: Table Model Example
example.description: The Table Model example shows how to use a specialized SQL table model with table views to edit information in a database.

example.name: Tablet Example
example.description: The Tablet example shows how to use a Wacom tablet in Qt applications.

example.name: Task Menu Extension Example
example.description: The Task Menu Extension example shows how to create a custom widget plugin for Qt Designer, and how to to use the QDesignerTaskMenuExtension class to provide custom task menu entries associated with the plugin.

example.name: Tetrix Example
example.description: The Tetrix example is a Qt version of the classic Tetrix game.

example.name: Text Finder Example
example.description: The Text Finder example demonstrates how to dynamically process forms using the QtUiTools module.

example.name: Text Object Example
example.description: The Text Object example shows how to insert an SVG file into a QTextDocument.

example.name: Text: Banner Fonts Example
example.description: These example shows how to manipulate text in various ways.

example.name: Text: Fonts Example
example.description: These examples shows how to display a text with multiple fonts.

example.name: Text: Hello Fonts Example
example.description: This example shows how to manipulate text in various ways.

example.name: Text: Text Selection Example
example.description: This example shows how text selection, copy and paste operations can be implemented on top of the TextEdit element.

example.name: Textures Example
example.description: The Textures example demonstrates the use of Qt's image classes as textures in applications that use both OpenGL and Qt to display graphics.

example.name: The Webkit Bridge Tutorial - Hybrid Client Application
example.description: In this example, we will show how to write a hybrid application using QtWebKit Bridge, which distinguishes itself from a thin client in that it performs heavy calculations on the client side in C++, like a native application, but presents nothing more than a for its user interface, displaying web content written in HTML/JavaScript.

example.name: Threaded Fortune Server Example
example.description: The Threaded Fortune Server example shows how to create a server for a simple network service that uses threads to handle requests from different clients.

example.name: Tool Tips Example
example.description: The Tool Tips example shows how to provide static and dynamic tool tips for an application's widgets.

example.name: Torrent Example
example.description: The Torrent example is a functional BitTorrent client that illustrates how to write a complex TCP/IP application using Qt.

example.name: Touch Dials Example
example.description: The Touch Dials example shows how to apply touch to a set of standard Qt widgets.

example.name: Touch Interaction: MouseArea Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the MouseArea element to access information about mouse input.

example.name: Touch Knobs Example
example.description: The Touch Knobs example shows how to create custom controls that accept touch input.

example.name: Toys: Clocks Example
example.description: This example displays a set of clocks with different times for different cities.

example.name: Toys: Corkboards Example
example.description: This example presents a flickable set of interactive corkboards. It is created through a combination of elements like ListModel, Repeater and TextEdit together with rotation and scaling transforms, animation and mouse interaction.

example.name: Toys: Dynamic Scene Example
example.description: This example presents an interactive drag-and-drop scene. It demonstrates how to use QML's Dynamic Object Creation support to dynamically create and destroy objects.

example.name: Toys: TV Tennis Example
example.description: This example shows how to use animation components such as SpringAnimation, SequentialAnimation and PropertyAction to create a game of TV tennis.

example.name: Toys: Tic-Tac-Toe Example
example.description: This example presents a simple implementation of Tic Tac Toe.

example.name: Traffic Light Example
example.description: The Traffic Light example shows how to use The State Machine Framework to implement the control flow of a traffic light.

example.name: TrafficInfo Example
example.description: The Traffic Info example shows how XQuery can be used extract information from WML documents provided by a WAP service.

example.name: Transformations Example
example.description: The Transformations example shows how transformations influence the way that QPainter renders graphics primitives. In particular it shows how the order of transformations affect the result.

example.name: Tree Model Completer Example
example.description: The Tree Model Completer example shows how to provide completion facilities for a hierarchical model, using a period as the separator to access Child, GrandChild and GrandGrandChild level objects.

example.name: Trivial Wizard Example
example.description: The Trivial Wizard example illustrates how to create a linear three-page registration wizard using three instances of QWizardPage and one instance of QWizard.

example.name: Troll Print Example
example.description: Troll Print is an example application that lets the user choose printer settings. It comes in two versions: English and Portuguese.

example.name: UI Components: Dial Control Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a dial-type control. It combines Image elements with Rotation transforms and SpringAnimation behaviors to produce an interactive speedometer-type dial.

example.name: UI Components: Flipable Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the Flipable element.

example.name: UI Components: Progress Bars Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a progress bar.

example.name: UI Components: Scroll Bar Example
example.description: This example shows how to create scroll bars for a Flickable element using the Flickable::visibleArea properties.

example.name: UI Components: Search Box Example
example.description: This example shows how to combine TextInput, FocusScope and BorderImage elements to display multiple text input fields.

example.name: UI Components: Slide Switch Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a slide switch control.

example.name: UI Components: Spinner Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a spinner-type component using the PathView element.

example.name: UI Components: Tab Widget Example
example.description: This example shows how to create a tab widget. It also demonstrates how property aliases and default properties can be used to collect and assemble the child items declared within an Item.

example.name: Undo Framework Example
example.description: The Undo Framework example shows how to implement undo/redo functionality with the Qt undo framework.

example.name: Video Graphics Item Example
example.description: The Video Graphics Item example shows how to implement a QGraphicsItem that displays video on a graphics scene using QtMultimedia's QAbstractVideoSurface.

example.name: Video Widget Example
example.description: The Video Widget example shows how to implement a video widget using QtMultimedia's QAbstractVideoSurface

example.name: Web FTP Client Example
example.description: The Web FTP Client example shows how to add support for a new protocol to QtWebKit-based applications.

example.name: Web Plugin Example
example.description: The Web Plugin example shows how to communicate between a Qt widget embedded in a Web page and the page itself.

example.name: Widgets Tutorial - Child Widgets
example.description: No description available

example.name: Widgets Tutorial - Creating a Window
example.description: No description available

example.name: Widgets Tutorial - Nested Layouts
example.description: No description available

example.name: Widgets Tutorial - Using Layouts
example.description: No description available

example.name: Wiggly Example
example.description: The Wiggly example shows how to animate a widget using QBasicTimer and timerEvent(). In addition, the example demonstrates how to use QFontMetrics to determine the size of text on screen.

example.name: Window Flags Example
example.description: The Window Flags example shows how to use the window flags available in Qt.

example.name: World Time Clock Builder Example
example.description: The World Time Clock Builder example shows how forms created with Qt Designer that contain custom widgets can be dynamically generated at run-time.

example.name: World Time Clock Plugin Example
example.description: The World Time Clock Plugin example shows how to create a custom widget plugin for Qt Designer that uses signals and slots.

example.name: XML Schema Validation Example
example.description: The XML Schema Validation example shows how to use QtXmlPatterns to validate XML with a W3C XML Schema.

example.name: XML: XMLHttpRequest Example
example.description: This example shows how to use the XmlHttpRequest API in QML.
